Alert.Headline: Berwyn Station Temporary Closure
Alert.ShortDescription: Berwyn station is temporarily closed. Please use the adjacent stations at Bryn Mawr or Argyle (enter Argyle station 1 block south of Berwyn on Foster Ave).

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
Berwyn station is temporarily closed. 

Please use the adjacent stations at Bryn Mawr or Argyle, located within a few blocks of Berwyn station (enter Argyle station one block south of Berwyn on Foster Ave).

Why is service being changed?
Berwyn station is temporarily closed for reconstruction as part of the Red and Purple Modernization (RPM) Program.

Alert.Headline: Lawrence Station Temporary Closure
Alert.ShortDescription: Lawrence stn is temporarily closed. Please use adjacent stations at Argyle (enter on Winona) or Wilson. 81 Lawrence bus rerouted to connect to Wilson station.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
Lawrence station is temporarily closed. 

Please use the adjacent stations at Argyle (enter on Winona St) or Wilson, located within a few blocks of Lawrence station.

In addition, #81 Lawrence buses is rerouted to serve Wilson station for the duration of the temporary closure. See separate alert for details.

Why is service being changed?
Lawrence station is temporarily closed for reconstruction as part of the Red and Purple Modernization (RPM) Program.

Alert.Headline: Temporary Reroute
Alert.ShortDescription: 81 Lawrence buses operates in both directions via Lawrence, Ashland, Wilson, Broadway and Lawrence.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
Buses operate in both directions via Lawrence, Ashland, Wilson, Broadway and Lawrence.

Buses connect at Wilson station with Red Line trains, as well as Purple Line Express trains.

Allow extra travel time.

Why is service being changed?
Buses are rerouted due to the temporary closure of Lawrence station for reconstruction as part of the Red and Purple Modernization (RPM) Program.

Map

Click for a larger view.

Alert.Headline: Temporary Bus Stop Change
Alert.ShortDescription: Eastbound and westbound 81 Lawrence bus stops at the closed Lawrence Red Line station are temporarily discontinued.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
The eastbound bus stop on the south side of Lawrence and westbound bus stop on the north side of Lawrence at the closed Lawrence Red Line station are temporarily discontinued.

Board buses 1 block west on Broadway south of Lawrence, or 1-1/2 blocks east on Lawrence west of Kenmore.

Why is service being changed?
The bus stops are temporarily discontinued due to the temporary closure of Lawrence station for reconstruction as part of the Red and Purple Modernization (RPM) Program.

Alert.Headline: Temporary Bus Stops Added
Alert.ShortDescription: 81 Lawrence: Westbound stop temporarily added on northwest corner at Wilson/Clark. Eastbound stop temporarily added on southwest corner at Wilson/Clark.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
A westbound stop has been temporarily added on the northwest corner at Wilson/Clark.

An eastbound stop has been temporarily added on the southwest corner at Wilson/Clark.

Why is service being changed?
The bus stops have been temporarily added for the convenience of customers while the #81 is rerouted due to the Red and Purple Modernization (RPM) Program.

Alert.Headline: Service to Desplaines/Harrison Temporarily Discontinued
Alert.ShortDescription: #36 service to Desplaines/Harrison will be temporarily discontinued.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
#36 Broadway service to Desplaines/Harrison (operates late evening only) will be temporarily discontinued.

At all times, service will begin and end at the LaSalle Metra station.

Alternate service to/from Desplaines/Harrison is available via the #60 Blue Island/26th bus route.

Why is service being changed?
Service to Desplaines/Harrison is affected due to viaduct construction on Harrison.

Alert.Headline: Temporary Bus Stop Change
Alert.ShortDescription: The SB #22 and #24 bus stop mid-block on Clark between Madison and Monroe will be temporarily discontinued. Use Clark/Randolph or Clark/Adams for SB buses.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
The southbound bus stop located mid-block on Clark between Madison and Monroe will be temporarily discontinued.

For #22 Clark and #24 Wentworth service, use either of the bus stops at Clark/Randolph or Clark/Adams.

Why is service being changed?
The bus stop is temporarily discontinued due to construction. 

MAP

Alert.Headline: Temporary Reroute (Revised 5/5/25)
Alert.ShortDescription: EB 84 buses operate via Bryn Mawr, Sheridan & Thorndale to Red Line; WB trips begin at Thorndale Red Ln, operate via Thorndale, B'way, Devon, Clark and Ridge.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
Eastbound buses operate via Bryn Mawr, Sheridan and Thorndale, ending their trips at the Thorndale Red Line station.

Westbound buses begin their trips at the Thorndale Red Line station, operate via Thorndale, Broadway, Devon and Clark, then resume their normal route on Ridge. (Westbound reroute updated May 5, 2025 due to unrelated work on Ridge at Victoria.)

Buses connect with Red Line trains at Bryn Mawr station (service toward downtown and 95th only) and Thorndale station (service toward Howard, and toward downtown and 95th).

Allow extra travel time.

Why is service being changed?
Buses are rerouted due to the start of Red and Purple Modernization (RPM) Stage B construction and the opening of a new temporary Bryn Mawr station with Red Line service toward 95th only; routing buses to Thorndale station continues direct connection to Red Line service in both directions, toward Howard and 95th.

Alert.Headline: Boarding Change at Wilson
Alert.ShortDescription: West platform at Wilson is temporarily closed. Board/exit all trains on the east platform.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
The west platform at Wilson is temporarily closed. Board/exit all trains on the east platform.

On the east platform, Red Line trains to Howard and Purple Line trains to Linden board on the outside track. Red Line trains to 95th and Purple Line trains to the Loop board on the inside track.

Why is service being changed?
The Wilson west platform is temporarily closed due to the reconstruction of the two west tracks between Thorndale and Wilson stations as part of the Red and Purple Modernization (RPM) project.

Map

Click on map for larger view.

Alert.Headline: Argyle Temporary Station Relocation
Alert.ShortDescription: The temporary Argyle station on Argyle St is closed and a new temp Argyle station open 1-2 blks north, with staffed entrances on Foster Ave and Winona St.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
The temporary Argyle station on W Argyle St is closed, and a new temporary Argyle station is open.

The new temporary Argyle station is located 1-2 blocks north, and has two staffed entrances:

  • On Foster Avenue, south side
  • On Winona Street, north side (1 block north of Argyle St)

Red Line trains in both directions – toward Howard, and toward downtown and 95th – stop at the new temporary Argyle station.

Why is service being changed?
A new temporary Argyle station is open due to the start of Red and Purple Modernization (RPM) Program Stage B construction and the reconstruction of the two west tracks between Bryn Mawr and Wilson stations.

Map

Click on map for larger view.

Alert.Headline: Bryn Mawr Temporary Station Relocated, 95th-bound Service Only
Alert.ShortDescription: Temp Bryn Mawr stn entrances on B'way & Bryn Mawr Av closed; new temp Bryn Mawr stn open 75ft east of old stn under viaduct. Only 95th-bnd srvc at new temp stn.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
The temporary Bryn Mawr station entrances on N Broadway and on Bryn Mawr Avenue under the old "L" viaduct have closed, and a new temporary Bryn Mawr station has opened.

The new temporary Bryn Mawr station entrance is located on the south side of Bryn Mawr Avenue, 75 feet east of the old entrance under the "L" viaduct.

The new temporary Bryn Mawr station is only served by Red Line trains toward downtown and 95th; Howard-bound trains do not stop at the new temporary Bryn Mawr station.

For Howard-bound service from the station, take a 95th-bound train to Argyle and transfer to a Howard-bound train.

For Howard-bound service to the station, take Howard-bound train to Thorndale and transfer to 95th-bound train back to Bryn Mawr.

Customers can also access Red Line service in both directions at the adjacent stations at Thorndale (1/2-mile north) or the new temporary Argyle station Foster Avenue entrance (1/2-mile south). #84 Peterson buses will be rerouted to connect to both the Bryn Mawr and Thorndale stations. #36 Broadway buses, 1/2-block west on Broadway, also can be used to connect to all three stations. Transfers between buses and trains are free.

Allow extra travel time for Howard-bound trips.

Why is service being changed?
A new temporary Bryn Mawr station was opened due to the start of Red and Purple Modernization (RPM) Program Stage B construction and the reconstruction of the two west tracks between Bryn Mawr and Wilson stations. There will be no Howard-bound service at the new temporary Bryn Mawr station because there is not enough space on the east side of the new elevated track structure to build a temporary 8-car platform for Howard-bound trains.

Map

Click on map for larger view.

Alert.Headline: Temporary Reroute
Alert.ShortDescription: NB #192 buses will operate via Roosevelt, Jefferson, Monroe, and Canal, then resume their normal route on Madison. SB buses are not affected.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
Northbound buses will operate via Roosevelt, Jefferson, Monroe, and Canal, then resume their normal route on Madison.

Southbound buses are not affected.

Allow extra travel time.

BUS BOARDING LOCATIONS:

Bus Route

Board Buses

#192 (PM rush periods only)
  • Board northbound buses on the southwest corner at Monroe/Clinton

 

 

 

Why is service being changed?
Buses are rerouted due to CDOT’s Canal Street Reconstruction Project.

Alert.Headline: Temporary Reroute
Alert.ShortDescription: EB #60 and NB #125 uses will operate via Harrison and Jefferson to Monroe. EB #60 via Monroe, Canal, then Washington. NB #125 via Monroe, Canal.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
Eastbound #60 Blue Island/26th and northbound #125 Water Tower Express buses will operate via Harrison and Jefferson to Monroe.

Eastbound #60 buses will operate via Monroe and Canal, then resume their normal route on Washington.

Northbound #125 buses will operate via Monroe, then resume their normal
route on Canal.

BUS BOARDING LOCATIONS:

Bus Route

Board Buses Here:

#60
  • Board eastbound buses on the northeast corner at Jefferson/Harrison
  • Board eastbound buses on the northeast corner at Jefferson/ Van Buren
  • Board eastbound buses on the northeast corner at Jefferson/ Jackson
  • Board eastbound buses on the southwest corner at Monroe/Clinton

 

Bus Route

Board Buses Here:

#125
  • Board eastbound buses on the northeast corner at Jefferson/Harrison
  • Board eastbound buses on the northeast corner at Jefferson/ Van Buren
  • Board eastbound buses on the northeast corner at Jefferson/ Jackson
  • Board eastbound buses on the southwest corner at Monroe/Clinton

 

Allow extra travel time.

Why is service being changed?
Buses are rerouted due to CDOT’s Canal Street Reconstruction Project.

Alert.Headline: Temporary Reroute
Alert.ShortDescription: WB #124 buses will operate Madison, Clinton, ending trips on Clinton between Adams and Quincy. EB via Clinton, Van Buren, Jefferson, and Monroe, then  Canal.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
Westbound buses will operate via Madison and Clinton, ending their trips on Clinton between Adams and Quincy.

Eastbound buses will operate via Clinton, Van Buren, Jefferson, and Monroe, then resume their normal route on Canal.

Allow extra travel time.

BUS BOARDING LOCATIONS:

Bus Route

Board Buses Here:

#124
  • Board westbound buses on the northwest corner at Clinton/Quincy
  • Board eastbound buses on the northeast corner at Jefferson/ Van Buren
  • Board eastbound buses on the northeast corner at Jefferson/ Jackson
  • Board eastbound buses on the southwest corner at Monroe/Clinton

 

Why is service being changed?
Buses are rerouted due to CDOT’s Canal Street Reconstruction Project.

Alert.Headline: Temporary Reroute
Alert.ShortDescription: NB #157 buses will operate via Taylor, Jefferson, and Monroe, then resume their normal route on Canal. SB buses are not affected.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
Northbound buses will operate via Taylor, Jefferson, and Monroe, then resume their normal route on Canal.

Southbound buses are not affected.

Allow extra travel time.

BUS BOARDING LOCATIONS:

Bus Route

Board Buses

#157
  • Board eastbound bus stop on the northeast corner at Jefferson/Taylor
  • Board eastbound bus stop on the northeast corner at Jefferson/Polk
  • Board eastbound buses on the northeast corner at Jefferson/Harrison
  • Board eastbound buses on the northeast corner at Jefferson/ Van Buren
  • Board eastbound buses on the northeast corner at Jefferson/ Jackson
  • Board eastbound buses on the southwest corner at Monroe/Clinton


Why is service being changed?

Alert.Headline: Temporary Route Extension
Alert.ShortDescription: #1 buses will no longer start or end their trips at Union Station (Adams/Canal). Trips begin/end at Desplaines/Harrison. Boarding at Union Station is unchanged.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
Buses will no longer start or end their trips at Union Station (Adams/Canal).

From Union Station, northbound buses will operate via Clinton, Van Buren, and Desplaines, ending their trips at Desplaines/Harrison.

Southbound buses will begin their trips at Desplaines/Harrison, then will operate to Union Station via Harrison, Jefferson, and Jackson to Clinton, then continue their normal route on Jackson.

The boarding location for #1 buses at Union Station has not changed.

Why is service being changed?
Service is affected due to an ongoing construction project in the area.

Alert.Headline: Temporary Bus Stop Change
Alert.ShortDescription: #121 buses will no longer board on Jackson west of Canal (Stop A). Board buses in the Union Station Transit Center, just south of the current stop, at Stop C.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
Buses will no longer board on Jackson west of Canal (Stop ) . Instead, customers can board buses in the Union Station Transit Center, just south of the current stop, adjacent to #28 Stony Island buses (Stop ).

Why is service being changed?
Service is affected due to an ongoing construction project in the area.

Alert.Headline: Temporary Reroute
Alert.ShortDescription: EB #7 via Harrison, Jefferson, and Jackson. NB #37 via Van Buren, Clinton, Harrison, Jefferson, and Jackson. WB #7 and SB #37 buses are not affected.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
Eastbound #7 Harrison buses will operate via Harrison, Jefferson, and Jackson to Canal, then continue their normal route on Jackson.

Northbound #37 Sedgwick buses will operate via Van Buren, Clinton, Harrison, Jefferson, and Jackson to Canal, then continue their normal route on Jackson.

Westbound #7 and southbound #37 buses are not affected.

Allow extra travel time.

Why is service being changed?
Buses are rerouted due to CDOT’s Canal Street Reconstruction Project.

BUS BOARDING LOCATIONS:

Bus Route

 Board Buses Here:

#7
  • Board eastbound buses on the northeast corner at Jefferson/Harrison
  • Board eastbound buses on the northeast corner at Jefferson/Van Buren
  • Board eastbound buses on the southwest corner at Jackson/Clinton

 

Bus Route

 Board Buses Here:

#37
  • Board northbound buses on the northeast corner at Jefferson/Harrison
  • Board northbound buses on the northeast corner at Jefferson/Van Buren
  • Board northbound buses on the southwest corner at Jackson/Clinton

MAP

Alert.Headline: Temporary Bus Stop Changes
Alert.ShortDescription: #88 and #90 buses will not enter the Harlem (OHare branch) Blue Line stations bus terminal. Board NB #88 buses at Stop F. Board SB #90 buses at Stop E.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
#88 Higgins and #90 Harlem buses will not enter the Harlem (O’Hare branch) Blue Line station’s bus terminal.

Board northbound #88 buses at Harlem/Bryn Mawr (Stop ). Southbound #88 buses are not affected.

Northbound #90 buses will end their trips at Harlem/Bryn Mawr (Stop ). Southbound #90 buses will begin their trips at Harlem/Bryn Mawr, operate via Harlem, Talcott, Sayre and Bryn Mawr, then resume their normal route on Harlem. Board southbound #90 buses on Harlem, just outside the station’s east entrance on Harlem (Stop ).

For information on service changes to Pace routes #209 and #423 visit pacebus.com.

Why is service being changed?
Buses are rerouted while we reconstruct the Harlem Blue Line station’s bus bridge over the Kennedy Expressway.

MAP

Alert.Headline: Harlem (OHare branch) Stations West Entrance Temporary Closure
Alert.ShortDescription: The west entrance to the Harlem (OHare branch) Blue Line station on Higgins Avenue and the adjacent Park and Ride lot will temporarily close.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
The west entrance to the Harlem (O’Hare branch) Blue Line station on Higgins Avenue and the adjacent Park and Ride lot will temporarily close.

To enter/exit the station and make connections with #88 Higgins and #90 Harlem buses, customers may use the east entrance on Harlem Avenue. See separately posted alerts and station signage for details.

Alternative parking is available at the Cumberland Blue Line Station (5800 N Cumberland Ave). For additional information or any questions please call (773) 714-9262 or visit Parking.com.

Why is service being changed?
The station’s west entrance and Park and Ride lot are temporarily closed while we reconstruct the Harlem Blue Line station’s bus bridge over the Kennedy Expressway.

MAP

Alert.Headline: Temporary Bus Stop Change
Alert.ShortDescription: The SB #22 and #24 bus stop on the SW corner at Clark/Lake will be temporarily discontinued.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
The southbound #22 Clark and #24 Wentworth bus stop on the southwest corner at Clark/Lake will be temporarily discontinued.

For southbound #22 and #24 service, board buses one block south at Clark/Randolph.

Why is service being changed?
The bus stop is changed due to construction and related sidewalk closures.

Alert.Headline: Temporary Bus Stop Change
Alert.ShortDescription:
The WB #152 stop on the SW corner at Addison/Lincoln will be temp discontinued. 
For WB svc, board/exit at Addison/Paulina or the Addison Brown Line station.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
The westbound #152 Addison bus stop on the northeast corner at Addison/Lincoln will be temporarily discontinued. 

For westbound service, board/exit at either of the bus stops at Addison/Paulina or the Addison Brown Line station.

Alert.Headline: Temporary Reroute
Alert.ShortDescription: #87 buses will operate in both directions via 87th, Cottage Grove, 83rd, Stony Island, and 87th.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
Buses will operate in both directions via 87th, Cottage Grove, 83rd, Stony Island, and 87th.

Allow extra travel time.

Why is service being changed?
Buses are rerouted due to Metra construction on 87th between Ingleside and Dobson.

Alert.Headline: Temporary Bus Stop Change
Alert.ShortDescription: The NB #49 and #X49 bus stop on the east side of Western at the Western Brown Line station will be temporarily relocated to the SE corner at Western/Eastwood.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
The northbound #49 Western and #X49 Western Express bus stop on the east side of Western at the Western Brown Line station will be temporarily relocated to the southeast corner at Western/Eastwood. 

Why is service being changed?
The bus stop is changed due to construction and related sidewalk closures.

Alert.Headline: Elevator at 79th Temporarily Out-of-Service
Alert.ShortDescription: The elevator at 79th (Red Line) is temporarily out-of-service due to a mechanical issue.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
The elevator at 79th (Red Line) is temporarily out-of-service due to a mechanical issue.

The elevator is currently estimated to return to service on Friday August 29, 2025 (Note: date subject to change).

Crews are working to return this elevator to service as quickly as possible.

Learn more about the work we do to maintain, repair and upgrade elevators.

Alert.Headline: Temporary Bus Stop Change
Alert.ShortDescription: The EB and WB #201 and #206 bus stops at Central and Green Bay Road will be temporarily relocated to Central and Prairie (West Leg).

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
The westbound #201 Central/Ridge and #206 Evanston Circulator bus stop on the northwest corner at Central and Green Bay Road will be temporarily relocated to the northwest corner at Central and Prairie (West Leg). 

The eastbound #201 and #206 bus stop on the southwest corner at Central and Green Bay Road will be temporarily relocated to the southwest corner at Central and Prairie (West Leg).

Why is service being changed?
Buses are rerouted due to construction and related sidewalk closures.

Alert.Headline: Temporary Bus Stop Change
Alert.ShortDescription: The EB #11 and SB #49B stop on the south side of Leland at the Western Brown Line station will be temporarily out of service. Board/exit buses in the terminal.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
The eastbound #11 Lincoln and southbound #49B North Western bus stop on the south side of Leland (drop-off only) at the Western Brown Line station will be temporarily out of service.

Exit eastbound #11 and southbound #49B buses at the Western Brown Line bus terminal.

Why is service being changed?
The bus stop is changed due to construction and related sidewalk closures.

Alert.Headline: Service for 2025 Cubs Night Games and Wrigley Field Concerts
Alert.ShortDescription: Skokie-bound Yellow Line trains will operate until 12am (midnight) for weekday and weekend Cubs night games and Wrigley Field concerts.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
Additional service from Howard will operate on the Yellow Line for weekday and weekend Cubs night games and Wrigley Field concerts. Skokie-bound trains will operate until 12am (midnight) on game and concert nights.

Why is service being changed?
Extra service is being provided for the convenience of customers attending weekday and weekend Cubs night games and Wrigley Field concerts.

Alert.Headline: CTA Service to the Beaches
Alert.ShortDescription: Effective Sun, Mar 23 thru mid-Aug, service to the lakefront and beaches will be expanded on the #35, #63, #72, and #78 bus routes on weekends and holidays.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
For customer convenience, service to the lakefront and beaches will be
expanded to operate as follows:

Weekends/Holidays - Sun, March 23 through mid-August

Bus Routes Buses will begin/end their trips at: Times
#35 31st/35th 31st Street Beach between approximately 9am and 9:30pm
#63rd 63rd 63rd Street Beach between approximately 9am and 9:30pm
#72 North North Avenue Beach between approximately 9am and 9:30pm
#78 Montrose Montrose Beach between approximately 9am and 9:30pm

Alert.Headline: Red and Purple Line Trains Share Track between Thorndale and Wilson
Alert.ShortDescription: Red and Purple line trains share tracks btwn Thorndale and Wilson. Purple Line Express trains continue to make only express stops between Howard and Wilson.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip? 
Red Line trains and Purple Line Express trains are sharing the same tracks between Thorndale and Wilson.

Purple Line Express trains continue to run express between Howard and Wilson.

Note: At the same time, Berwyn and Lawrence are temporarily closed and temporary stations are open at Bryn Mawr and Argyle, to support reconstruction work. See separate alerts for details.

Allow extra travel time.

Why is service being changed? 
Red and Purple line service is changed due to the temporary closure of the two west tracks between Bryn Mawr and Wilson stations for reconstruction as part of the Red and Purple Modernization (RPM) project.

Alert.Headline: Red and Purple Line Trains Share Track between Thorndale and Wilson
Alert.ShortDescription: Red and Purple line trains share tracks btwn Thorndale and Wilson. Purple Line Express trains continue to make only express stops between Howard and Wilson.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip? 
Red Line trains and Purple Line Express trains are sharing the same tracks between Thorndale and Wilson.

Purple Line Express trains continue to run express between Howard and Wilson.

Note: At the same time, Berwyn and Lawrence are temporarily closed and temporary stations are open at Bryn Mawr and Argyle, to support reconstruction work. See separate alerts for details.

Allow extra travel time.

Why is service being changed?
Red and Purple line service is changed due to the temporary closure of the two west tracks between Bryn Mawr and Wilson stations for reconstruction as part of the Red and Purple Modernization (RPM) project.

Alert.Headline: Temporary Reroute
Alert.ShortDescription: #56 buses will operate in both directions via Milwaukee, Chicago, Halsted and Milwaukee.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
Buses will operate in both directions via Milwaukee, Chicago, Halsted and Milwaukee.

Allow extra travel time.

Why is service being changed?
Buses are rerouted due to CDOT construction on Milwaukee between Chicago and Kinzie.

Alert.Headline: Temporary Bus Stop Change
Alert.ShortDescription: The EB #80 bus stop on the SE corner at Irving Park/Cumberland will be temporarily discontinued.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
The eastbound #80 Irving Park bus stop on the southeast corner at Irving Park/Cumberland will be temporarily discontinued. 

For eastbound #80 service, board buses at Irving Park/Plainfield, two blocks east. 

Why is service being changed?
The bus stop is changed due to construction and related sidewalk closures.

Alert.Headline: Temporary Reroute
Alert.ShortDescription: EB #84 buses will operate via Ridge, Clark, Ashland, Foster, Broadway, and Bryn Mawr. WB buses will operate via Thorndale, Broadway, Devon, Clark, and Ridge.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
Eastbound buses will operate via Ridge, Clark, Ashland, Foster and Broadway, then resume their normal route on Bryn Mawr.

Westbound buses will operate via Thorndale, Broadway, Devon, and Clark, then resume their normal route on Ridge.

Allow extra travel time.

Why is service being changed?
Buses are rerouted due to CDOT construction on Ridge at Victoria.

Alert.Headline: Temporary Bus Stop Changes
Alert.ShortDescription: #152 bus stops at the Addison Blue Line station are changed due to IDOT construction on the Addison Bridge over the Kennedy Expressway (I-90/I-94).

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
The eastbound bus stop at the Addison Blue Line station (on the southwest corner at the Kennedy Expressway off-ramp) will be temporarily relocated mid-block between Central Park and Drake, approximately 145 feet east, in front of the Olive Garden. 

The westbound bus stop mid-block at the Addison Blue Line station will be temporarily relocated to the northwest corner at Addison/Drake, in front of the Athletic Field Park Fieldhouse.

The westbound bus stop on the northwest corner on Addison at Lawndale/Avondale will be temporarily discontinued. Board/exit westbound buses at Addison/Hamlin. 

Please cross streets at crosswalks. 

Why is service being changed?
The bus stop changes are due to IDOT construction on the Addison Bridge over the Kennedy Expressway (I-90/I-94). 

Map

Alert.Headline: Temporary Reroute
Alert.ShortDescription: SB #4 and #X4 buses operate via Cottage Grove, South Chicago, Greenwood, 75th, and Cottage Grove. NB via Cottage Grove, 75th, South Chicago, and Cottage Grove.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
Southbound #4 Cottage Grove, and #X4 Cottage Grove Express buses will operate via Cottage Grove, South Chicago, Greenwood, and 75th, then resume their normal route on Cottage Grove.

Northbound #4 and #X4 buses will operate via Cottage Grove, 75th, and South Chicago, then resume their normal route on Cottage Grove.

Note: #4 and #X4 buses will make stops at bus stops along the reroute.

Allow extra travel time.

Why is service being changed?
Buses are rerouted due to viaduct construction on Cottage Grove between 71st and 72nd.

MAP

Alert.Headline: Elevator at Kedzie Temporarily Out-of-Service
Alert.ShortDescription: The elevator to/from street at Kedzie (Green Line) is temporarily out-of-service while we work to ensure continued safe, convenient service.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
The elevator to/from street at Kedzie (Green Line) is temporarily out-of-service while we work to ensure continued safe, convenient service.

The elevator is currently estimated to return to service on Friday, June 27, 2025. (Note: date subject to change).

Crews are working to return this elevator to service as quickly as possible.

Learn more about the work we do to maintain, repair and upgrade elevators.

Alert.Headline: Temporary Reroute
Alert.ShortDescription: NB & SB #29, and SB #36, #62 buses rerouted off State Street Bridge over Chicago River.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
Northbound #29 State buses will operate via State, Wacker, and Dearborn, then resume their normal route on Illinois.
 
Southbound #29 State and #36 Broadway buses will operate via State, Kinzie, Clark, and Wacker, then resume their normal route on State.
 
Southbound #62 buses will begin at Kinzie/Clark, operate via Clark, and Wacker, then resume their normal route on State.  
 
Northbound #36 and #62 buses are not affected. 
 
Allow extra travel time.
 
Why is service being changed?
Buses are rerouted due to maintenance on the State Street Bridge over the Chicago River.

Alert.Headline: Temporary Reroute
Alert.ShortDescription: #68 buses will operate in both directions via Northwest Highway, Devon, Ozanam, Ozark and Northwest Highway

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
Buses will operate in both directions via Northwest Highway, Devon, Ozanam, Ozark, and Northwest Highway

Allow extra travel time.

Why is service being changed? 
Buses are rerouted due to  watermain construction.

Alert.Headline: Temporary Bus Stop Change
Alert.ShortDescription: The SB #29 bus stop on the southwest corner at State/45th will be temporarily relocated to the northwest corner at State/45th.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
The southbound #29 State bus stop on the southwest corner at State/45th will be temporarily relocated to the northwest corner at State/45th. 

Why is service being changed?
The bus stop is changed due to construction and related sidewalk closures.

Alert.Headline: Temporary Bus Stop Change
Alert.ShortDescription: The WB #12, #18 and #N62 bus stop at 328 W Roosevelt will be temporarily discontinued.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
The westbound #12 Roosevelt, #18 16th/18th and #N62 Archer (owl) bus stop at 328 W Roosevelt will be temporarily discontinued. 

Board/exit westbound buses at Roosevelt/Delano or Roosevelt/Canal. 

Why is service being changed?
The bus stop is changed due to construction on the Roosevelt Bridge over the Chicago River.

Alert.Headline: Boarding Change at Belmont Station
Alert.ShortDescription: Board/exit Kimball-bound Brown Line trains on the Red Line side of the Howard-, Kimball and Linden-bound platform at the Belmont station.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
Board/exit Kimball-bound Brown Line trains on the Red Line side of the Howard-, Kimball and Linden-bound platform at the Belmont station.

Brown Line trains to Kimball will share the inside track with Red Line trains to Howard through Belmont station, which may result in minor delays.

Allow extra travel time.

Why is service being changed?
We are performing construction on the Kimball-bound Brown Line track north of Belmont station as part of the Red and Purple Modernization (RPM) project.

Map

Alert.Headline: Temporary Reroute
Alert.ShortDescription: EB #47 buses will operate via 47th, Halsted, 43rd, and Wentworth, then resume their normal route on 47th. WB via 47th, LaSalle, 43rd, Halsted, and 47th.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?
Eastbound buses will operate via 47th, Halsted, 43rd, and Wentworth, then resume their normal route on 47th. 

Westbound buses will operate via 47th, LaSalle, 43rd, and Halsted, then resume their normal route on 47th.  

Allow extra travel time. 

Why is service being changed? 
Buses are rerouted due to construction on 47th between Halsted and Wentworth.

Alert.Headline: Bus Stop Changes
Alert.ShortDescription: #47 bus stops are changed at 47th/Langley (WB only) and 47th/Vincennes (EB, WB).

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?

  • The westbound #47 47th bus stop on the northeast corner at 47th/Langley will be eliminated. A new westbound #47 bus stop will be added on the northwest corner at 47th/Langley.
  • The westbound #47 47th bus stop on the northeast corner at 47th/Vincennes will be eliminated. A new westbound #47 bus stop will be added on the northwest corner at 47th/Vincennes.
  • The eastbound #47 47th bus stop on the southwest corner at 47th/Vincennes will be eliminated. A new eastbound #47 bus stop will be added on the southeast corner at 47th/Vincennes.

Alert.Headline: #55 Garfield Temporary Reroute at 55th/Cottage Grove-Garfield Red Line
Alert.ShortDescription: 55 Garfield buses are rr via 55th, Prairie, 59th, King Drive, Midway Plaisance, Woodlawn & 55th, due to police activity nr 55th/Cottage Grove-Garfield Red Line.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
How does this affect my trip?

#55 Garfield buses are temporarily rerouted in both directions via 55th, Prairie, 59th, King Drive, Midway Plaisance, Woodlawn, then resume their normal route on 55th, due to police activity near 55th/Cottage Grove-Garfield Red Line.

Allow extra travel time.

Alert.Headline: Elevator at Clark/Division Temporarily Out-of-Service
Alert.ShortDescription: The elevator to/from street at Clark/Division (Red Line) is temporarily out-of-service.

FullDescription.#cdata-section:
The elevator to/from street at Clark/Division (Red Line) is temporarily out-of-service.

Our crews are working to assess the repair time for this elevator—this alert will be updated with additional information if/when we can estimate its return to service.

Crews are working to return this elevator to service as quickly as possible.

Learn more about the work we do to maintain, repair and upgrade elevators.
